Reviews.Title: “Nice place, NO Service”
Reviews.Author: Abal1
Reviews.Content: They serve well during day, in the night they have no bar, no mini bar and no friendly support at all. Really poor night reception, unfriendly and w/o any competences. Hope we have no issues with such weak personnel here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: butterfliesitaly
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel definitely exceeded all expectations! Perfect location, being so close to St Mark's Square and in it's own little square. The shower was a great power shower, which was a relief after a day of sightseeing. The room was very big and clean. The breakfast was lovely, with a great choice of continental food. The reception were very friendly and made you feel welcome every time. We had the benefit of a canal view room, which added to the experience. And it was lovely waking up to see the gondolas going past.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Experience - Well be back”
Reviews.Author: Anna M
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was fantastic, the room was very comfortable, plenty of room and clean, boasting venetian decor, location fantastic, close to shops & San Marco Square. The staff was very professional, and helpful at all times. The breakfast was very good, overall a great hotel. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Angela F
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Venice. Each room was different (we had 5 rooms). Had to put 2 people per room even though a small family of 3 can sleep comfortably. Beds were a nice size. Unfortunately, one of the rooms had a bad odour and a maid was sent to check it out. She sprayed the room but that didn't help Since we had 5 rooms, we left that one empty and put 3 people in each of 2 rooms. The breakfast was great! The waiters and waitresses were very friendly. The front dest staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was within comfortable walking distance to San Marco Square and the markets. Loved Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Richard016
Reviews.Content: Loved it - room small but wonderfully venetian. Breakfast room authentic & food plentiful. Couldn't be in a better position - easy to walk quickly to vaporetto & sights but not too busy/noisy. Would highly recommend for value, location and general ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Carneval with business trip value”
Reviews.Author: Abal1
Reviews.Content: The service great, the room tiny and sweet and the breakfast italian. Close to vaporetto linea uno and to all sights of the city. Very central!!! This hotel is worth to stay in. Take care if you arrive late to Venice you find no bar open after 11.00 pm.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with character in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: madameblanc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bel Sito is an excellent 3 Stars hotel in a perfect location. A few minutes walk from San Marco Piazan and within close distance of vaporetto.Hotel is easy found if you come on the public boat from the airport. only a few minutes walk from San Marco Station Room was decent size and did appreciate the loby facility between room and bathroom which was perfect for walking shoes and winter coat. Hotel room was quiet and very well heated for this time of the year. It is a very old building and felt very comfortable to return to a warm room. Bathroom was in good working order and nice hot shower/Housekeeping were outstanding and room always perfectly done. Breakfast was available from 8 to 10 with a fresh continental selection as well as cereal and bread selection... Free coffee refill which has been appreciated. Reception staff has been very helpful and service has been outstanding... Would recommend it to anyone wishing a short break in Venice. The only minus if there is one... no drink facility in the room. Europe does not always offer this service but tea and coffee were available at anytime for us... Enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KScan
Reviews.Content: My first impression of Hotel Bel Sito was the impressive church that sits opposite. I arrived by train into San Lucia and caught a vapporetto to the local Giglio stop which is an easy transfer. Check in was pleasant and staff are friendly and helpful. I had a single room which was clean with lovely brocade material walls and windows which opened onto a canal. Being Venice the room is ridicously small and I kept banging my leg on the edge of the bed but the singing Gondoliri outside my window kept cheering me up. The other thing that Venice is good at is being in a perpetual state of renovation! Bel Sito were doing their low season renovations. With that comes the inevitable noise and dust however they were doing their best to keep it to a minimum though I did have to tell the workmen to stop leaving the door open as it was freezing. Breakfast was the usual nice spread of breads, fruit, cold cuts and croissants with endless juice, tea and coffee. My only gripes were the hardness of the pillows and the awful smell of toilet cleaner coming from the bathroom in the lobby otherwise it was a generally pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent older hotel in VENICE!”
Reviews.Author: Prayzur
Reviews.Content: It's Venice, so the building is a few hundred years old and the rooms and hallways are small. The hotel was clean and decently appointed with a 1950's flair. Breakfast was good, (cold meats and warm croissants) service was very helpful and friendly. Location is great, but how can you have a bad location on Venice? Water taxi dock in the back made leaving all too convenient. The bed was a bit firmer that I care for, but other may like it. The only downside was the lack of air conditioning. It had been turned off for the season. It was late October, but the rooms needed some air circulation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Spinners62
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff at front desk, breakfast and bar, all spoke good English. Good location with easy access to main attractions and access to boat transport is not that difficult, even if you are carrying luggage. Some steps to climb up and down going to hotel from when you get off the boat at San Marco. We got off there after catching the boat at the airport. Our room was clean and it was a reasonable size room. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: MichelleE7
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was its location. When we arrived by vaporetto it was just a short walk to the hotel without crossing any bridges. The hotel is centrally located within easy walking distance of most of the sites of Venice. San Marco was quite nearby. The room was small and nothing special, and the rates were high. Breakfast was OK, adequate but not exceptional. The hotel is located on a small square with a church across the way--very quiet and picturesque. If I came to Venice again I would try to find a better room. By the way, we didn't realize there is a canal right behind the hotel so you can take a water taxi right from the hotel. We took a water taxi when we left for the airport and it was great (and very expensive!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: terrillp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent trip to Venice. The Hotel was very quaint and charming, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast was the best of the 3 hotels we stayed at during our recent visit to Italy. The location was excellent and very convenient to St. Mark's Basilica, the Doge's Palace, etc.... I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone visiting Venice, Italy.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Mosquitos make lousy company”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: We thought we'd found a gem of a hotel when we booked it online- good location and reasonably priced in an expensive city. However... This hotel was terrible overall, and I'm not one given to hyperbole. The room felt very cheap (complete with mold in the bathroom and water stains on the furniture), our "view" was a concrete wall, and there were no "extras" whatsoever: no clock, no iron, no adapter for our power outlets. There were only 9 channels on the TV, 1 in English, and it was fuzzy. The advertised "free wi-fi" only works in the lobby. The primary manager behind the front desk generally seemed annoyed to assist you (however his assistants were very helpful). To top it all off, when our room felt stuffy (because it was warm during our early October visit), we tried to turn on the air but were told it had been turned off for the winter. We opened our one window, but there was no screen on it so we got lots of Venice's infamous tiger-mosquito bites which made the rest of our trip very uncomfortable. (I counted 22 bites on me from one night of sleeping with the window open.) Also, we were above the smoking patio so had lots of smoke waft into our room, and loud talking to keep us awake. Looking back I can laugh now that it's over, because just when things seemed to be at their worst, something else happened to take the cake. At the time, we were not laughing. It was the low point of our trip to Europe, and in such a beautiful, wonderful city. We had a poor experience with this establishment, and I sincerely suggest if you're looking for that perfect, romantic trip to Venice, you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ksall31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with close proximity to St Mark's and the Doge's palace. The staff was wonderful , very helpful with assisting us to make reservations for dinner and a concert. The breakfast was very good and included hardboiled eggs which is not always the case at other hotels. The rooms were updated and clean and about the only thng I can say that might be a little negative is that the bathrooms were tiny, although modernized. It is afterall a very old building so it is what you can expect in Venice. Overall a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It won't suit everyone . . . .”
Reviews.Author: SallyEnglish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst on a study tour and our group were fairly evenly divided into those who liked this hotel and those who didn't. My experience was very pleasant. There is a group of rooms towards the back of the hotel which have windows onto the canal, mine was one of these. It was a 'bijou' room - a single so no necessity for much space, but also the furnishing and dÃ©cor is very 'love-it-or-loathe-it' Venetian. Full opportunities to feel a bit like a Disney Princess should you choose to. The bathroom was narrow which could have been a problem had I wanted to see it as one, however the shower was big enough to dance in (yes, I did test that out) which makes a nice change for hotels. That said I was apparently very lucky with my room. Others in the group who had opted to share found that they had been allocated rooms where they had to banish some of the furniture to the corridor in order to fit in two people and two suitcases. Some had rooms at the front of the hotel which is opposite (very closely opposite) a church, with bells, which ring for services, and to mark the hours. Not everyone's cup of tea! The rooms facing the canal can get a little noisy in the early morning when the delivery boats or rubbish collection boats start up - but we had to be up and out early so it wasn't a problem for me. The location was superb, a couple of minutes walk from a stop on the Grand Canal and only a few minutes walk from the Piazza di San Marco. The Reception staff were very helpful and had excellent English. What lets this hotel down a little is the breakfast arrangements. The room where guests eat is very cramped and the tables are very close together - everyone's conversation can be overheard by everyone else. The food wasn't too bad - standard Italian hotel fare, but the coffee was deplorable! To be in Venice and be given instant coffee to drink seemed practically sacrilegious!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingstar99
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel for its location, very pleasant staff, great breakfasts ( good for vegetarians only the ham not an option) Our bedroom and bathroom were lovely, bigger than we had expected, comfotable and clean, overlooking the canal which was fine in late September. Pleasant patio overlooking the sqaure for drinks and/or a quiet place to read. Surprised not to find any info about hotel facilities, transport,places to see, concerts etc in the room. The reception staff were generally very helpful and patient but I don't always want to keep asking what must appear very obvious questions. It would be much more difficult in the height of the season.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: LBC1979
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Bel Sito from Rick Steves' guidebook. It was a great recommendation. The location is a close walk to many of the popular sights in Venice but off the beaten path enough for some peace and quiet. The staff is very helpful and gave us some great restaurants to visit. Our room was small, but clean and cool (A/C was needed in August!). The breakfast was traditional European style but had the best selection and food of our 3 hotels we stayed at this trip. I would definitely stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gem012
Reviews.Content: The Bel Sito, whilst not a luxury hotel offers the benefits of a great location, good service and the key essentials for a short break in this beautiful city. The hotel is situated close to a waterbus station and is set in an atmospheric square with some lovely interesting buildings nearby. There is a small terrace outside the hotel where you can sit and watch the world go by over a glass of wine or if you are lucky sit to have breakfast.We found the hotel to be beautifully clean with friendly and helpful staff . The Bel Sito offered what we needed for our short break in Venice, although our room didn't offer a view of any sort and lacked available refreshments in our room. Overall good value for money. Our rom although comfortable didn't offer a view of any sorts

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Ealingboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - around 5 minutes walk from San Marco, and in a fairly quiet square where nevertheless you can people watch from the small covered terrace outside the hotel. Only 2 minutes to the nearest vaporetta stop. We were in room 43. Clean, traditionally decorated and while a little on the small side it had a good sized en suite and - best of all - a balcony at the back of the hotel where it was a pleasant way to relax after a hard afternoon's sightseeing - sitting and listening to the Venice bells. Good air con - and we needed it as temperatures got up to around 40. Staff very friendly and helpful. All round a good experience and value for money..

Reviews.Title: “A welcome respite from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: travelerphile
Reviews.Content: Located across the palazzo from the Gritti Palace, a former haunt of Ernest Hemingway. We requested room #41 with a magnificent view of the San Mario Giglio church and the small piazza. Conveniently located in the San Marcos district and walking distance to St. Marks Square, the Rialto and the Doges Palace, the Bel Sito was a welcomed haven from the hordes of tourists we encountered who arrived in time for the national May Day holiday on May 1st.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, ok room”
Reviews.Author: puneetxgulati
Reviews.Content: *Very centrally located from all the important places and San Marco *Walking distance from vaporatto station * Small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, attentive staff & free WiFi.”
Reviews.Author: Ironleader
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a beautiful square, central to the most important sites & museums-- walk to almost anywhere. Breakfast offered a wonderful variety and excellent capacino. The wifi--best in the lobby and outdoor patio was excellent & free. The staff's restaurant recommendations were excellent. Not a luxury hotel but all the important stuff was done right and with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and great service”
Reviews.Author: novicetraveler008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located and the staff was exceptional! We used Antonio to set dinner reservations, gondola ride and water taxi service. Room was nice, very typical Venice. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DaniSan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 2 minutes walk from the Giglio Vapporetto stop and about 5 minutes walk from San Marco, the location was perfect for us as we spent only 24 hours in Venice, we went back to San Marco 3 times! The hotel has elevator which is great for a family travelling with a stroller, the room was in the small size and the shower super tiny, we had water all over after taking showers! The hotel was AC but the control is not in the room so we were a bit hot all night, hotel offers WiFi but didn't work in the room. The breakfast is served from 8-10am but this was not a problem for us as we didnt have to wake up early, the food is good and there are many healthy options. The staff is nice however I thought it was quite rude to tell me that if my son (22 months old) eats too much they will charge me for a full breakfast! and also when I asked for recommendation to eat in the area they didnt want to give me any information telling that they don't recommend places because everyone has different taste! They were very helpful to give me information about transportation to the airport though, water taxi from the hotel to the airport is about 100 euros but you can easily take the vapporetto to the train station and then the bus, total cost is 11 euros per person and you are there in 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: sky_cloud1211
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in San Marco area near the Giglio waterbus station. The room is very pleasant and the staffs are very polite. One of the receptionist even manage to recognise our face after chatting to us once and we are impressed. Limited choice on the breakfast but the dining lounge is very comfortable and nice. The room and shower room is great and clean! We love Venice and definitely love the hotel. I will definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Special Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: goldieDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 353 as we were 3 adults - ! room with twin/double bed and 1 room with single bed but ceiling was very low over this bed only about 9inches and no a.c. so wouldn't fancy being there in July or August! Agree re breakfast being late at 8am, we missed out as had early start. Also bar in hotel closed at 11pm. so not possible to get a nightcap when we came back after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: inkinannie
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Bel Sito. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great, just steps from the Santa Maria del Giglio vaporetto stop on line #1. Also very close to St. Marks and shopping. The hotel itself is an older property but well maintained and modernized. The breakfast was wonderful. The downside is that it is not convenient for an early am flight out of Venice, so our last night was spent at an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KWD_11
Reviews.Content: A friendly hotel in an excellent location, about 6 minutes walk from San Marco Piazza, and an easy walk from the landing stage for the boat that connects with San Marco Airport. We had a reasonable size room and a big bathroom that was very well equipped and spotlessly clean. The hotel is in a fairly quiet location, near a couple of inexpensive (by Venice standards) restaurants. Be warned that the nearby church bells will wake you at 7:00 am, but breakfast is not served until 8:00 am which doesn't help if you have to make an early start.

Reviews.Title: “Very Venetian”
Reviews.Author: csalmon79
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a perfect location. We got a view of the square and the magnificant church. Room was a little on the small side but i thinks it's expected over venice. Breakie was good, plenty to choose from. Staff were pleasant and we were allowed to leave our luggage (free) so we could have a wonder before we flew back.

Reviews.Title: “Small, great location with good service”
Reviews.Author: MikeOli
Reviews.Content: First lets get the bad out of the way. The room and the bathroom were very tiny (WOW a tiny room in Europe, get use to it, it's Europe. Have you seen their cars?). We had room 346, which had a view of the rooftops. But it was quiet and when you're tired of sightseeing, it's kind of nice to have a quiet place at night. The bed was a little on the hard side, but we slept ok. The breakfast they offer is good, for how breakfasts go in Europe (caffe',bread, juice, cold cuts, cheese and pastries). Our room and bathrooms were very clean with all the amenities needed for a few nights stay, including a safe. The location of this hotel in the Campo Giglio had easy access to Rialto, San Marco, etc... weather you were walking or using Vaporetto number one (and only #1). The Vaporetto is such a short walk (down a very narrow alley street) to the hotel, that when you're lugging luggage it's great not to have to walk a long way. They do have a tiny elevator with a couple of steps to it and the entrance is at ground level. If you decide to come in by water taxi they have an entrance of the side canal in the back. Now one of the assets of the hotel was Antonio. Antonio went out of his way many times to act not only as a front desk person, but also a concierge. For example, there was a transportation strike on Friday the 11th, the wife wanted to go to Murano, he suggested a co-promotion (no strings attached) with one of the glass foundries they were having at the time. With that he called a taxi and away we went free of charge. All in all, it was a great place to stay and if I ever go back to Venice I will stay here. Our stay was stress free and we really enjoyed it here. ps; remember Venice is a walking and walking and walking... city, so the easier you make it to get to your hotel, the less stressful it will be. We saw many people having a very stressful time trying to find some obscure place their hotel was at and having to cross countless little bridges with heavy luggage. Call me lazy, but I didn't have to bust my hump on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,hotel average”
Reviews.Author: Wendymcg_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bel Sito for 4 nights in march, 1st time in Venice. Was bit worried about dtaff etc after reading reviews but had no problems, reception staff polite and helpful and afficient. Hotel easy to find, great central location. Good things: Breakfast fine for continental, tea lukewarm water though, coffee better as out of machine so hot. Room - small but adequate, bathroom equipped with usual toiletries. Not so good: Terrible smell hits you as walk in reception and was there throughout stay. Was of stale water?? Luckily was not noticeable in room. Pillows were rock hard but bed large and comfortable. Few words about Venice itself that I hope will be of help to travellers, it is extremely expensive!! If you wish to eat out in restuarants every evening be prepared to pay!! Eg: 3 euros for a coke, 1.50 euros to use public toilets, 80 for a 40 min gondola ride. Attractions expensive to visit too. We found it better to eat meal at lunchtime as slightly cheaper and just have slice pizza ect at night. Venice is a beautiful unique city but very much geared for tourists. All restuarants seem to sell pretty much same food, even on back streets and away from city centre. We tried local's food eateries thinking they may be a better experience but were just as expensive and food seemed to be similar to other restuarants, there is lots to see in Venice and it is easy to spend hours just walking round looking at the shops and people so take comfortable shoes and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonJennie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend over Carnevale week. It is a 10 minute walk to St Mark's Square and 2 minutes from the nearest Vaparetto stop (Giglio). Beautiful, traditional decor, comfy beds, good bathroom facilities. Great value. Would definitely use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TravelReviewer_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in October 2010. Of the 8 hotels we stayed in during our 6 weeks in Europe, this hotel had the best breakfast by far. A good range of sweet and savoury but best of all are the fresh pastries baked daily. Also, the table service at breakfast is very quick and friendly. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful even when we made enquiries before we made our reservations. Even my boyfriend said that he felt treated like a family member. Good sized room with a little entrance area where we stored our shoes and suitcases - this made the room much more spacious. Good sized room and bathroom and housekeeping thoroughly cleaned our room daily. (The only note is our room we didn't have air con. We didn't need to use an air con but the room we had would get hot quickly in the warmer weather.) There is a great deli that sells delicious slices of cakes at reasonable slices that the locals flocked to while we were there (exit the hotel, turn right and it's on the right hand side just before the first little bridge). We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Breakfast, Hot and Old Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jkjetsetters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Venice at the tail end of our 10 day trip in 4 cities in Italy. We were very tired by the end of our trip so take that into consideration when reading this review. The hotel was in a great location, very close to the grand canal and St. Mark's square. The breakfast was great, the service was ok. The staff was not as friendly as we had experienced elsewhere in other cities (Rome, Florence, CT.) The biggest issue was that we were here during the beginning of May and while it was not hot or even warm for that matter, the nights we slept there were miserable. We checked in and left to go sightsee, well the maids came in to clean the room and left the windows open (we had left them closed) only to let a TON of mosquitos into the room (no screens on the window which is to be expected in an older hotel), we spent the entire course of our night waking up to the sound of screeching mosquitos biting us and us killing them on the pre-carpeted walls (was not sure about these walls and what was really behind them?). The plus side was that the concierge were helpful in getting us info on our flights and using their laptop to check our departing flighst. The breakfast was standard but good. I would likely NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Book in advance and request a double room”
Reviews.Author: megamo
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Vencie for the first time after midnight and couldn't find my hotel. Exhausted, I stepped into the Bel Sito. They accomodated me and I was quite happy not to be sleeping on the streets! But my urgency paid the price. A miniscule single room the size of closet with sad overly worn decor and I was gouged on the price (about double the going rate I later learned) . The decor in the main common areas is quite tasteful and the staff was nice, but I was happy to depart in the morning after only 8 hours on the premises. Oh- and there is no WiFi in the rooms, only down in the lobby, even though at check in, the night clerk will tell you otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “We Wouldn't Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkiwizzit
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of positive reviews about this hotel so I was so looking forward to my trip to Venice. I had looked at the hotel website and how it is portrayed is very deceiving indeed. The rooms are tiny, the bathrooms (well, we had a shower room) are miniscule. We were taken up to our room on arrival and were really disappointed, so disappointed in fact that my husband insisted on going back to reception to ask for a different room. I had booked this hotel with them directly and paid for it in advance, otherwise I am sure we would have gone somewhere else. To be fair, the guy on reception was very helpful and found us an alternative room - sadly, it wasn't much better although it did have a little balcony (although the outlook wasn't much so we didn't use it). When making the booking, I had made it clear that this was special trip celebrating a special birthday so we wanted one of their better rooms. Well, if the two that we saw were their better rooms, I shouldn't like to imagine what the rest are like!! On a positive note though, the location of the hotel is fantastic - a 2 minute walk from the water bus and only a 5-10 minute walk from St Mark's. Breakfast is a standard continental one but there was lots of choice and it was pleasant. We had a problem with our shower in our room which we reported to the reception and when eventually they tried to fix it, it remained temperamental. Again, on a positive note, for our patience in waiting for the shower to be fixed, we were given a complimentary bottle of wine which was a nice gesture. On the day of our departure, we had to check out by 11am but weren't leaving Venice until about 5pm so we left our luggage at the hotel until we were ready to leave. When we came to collect our luggage later that day, we were informed that we owed them an extra 23 euros. (To cut a long story short, we had booked this trip approx a month before and were unable to travel at the last minute so the hotel agreed to grant us a credit voucher if we rebooked, as we had paid in advance. When I had rebooked, I didn't book over the internet as I had previously, but I phoned the hotel reception and checked availability with them verbally before booking my flights. At that time, I asked if there would be anything extra to pay and I was told definitely no). So, I was a bit taken aback when I was asked to pay an extra 23 euros. Ok, it was only 23 euros, but nothing had been mentioned when we had checked out in the morning and when I explained to the receptionist that I wasn't happy about it but I would pay it, he got very defensive and quite sharp with me - not good customer service in my opinion. All in all, its a pretty shabby hotel and apart from one or two of the staff, their customer service skills leave alot to be desired. Venice is so beautiful though, I didn't let my disappointment of our accommodation spoil our trip. Its supposed to be a 3-star but I would say it's nearer a 1-star. Wouldn't ever return to this hotel and wouldn't recommend anyone else to stay their either!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: suebudd
Reviews.Content: It seems very unfair that the first review on Trip Advisor should give such a negative impression of this hotel. We have just returned from a week-long stay at Bel Sito, and found all the staff - reception desk, waing staff and cleaners - unfailingly helpful and courteous. We stayed in rooms 128 and 127, which both overlooked the Baroque church in the square. Although we thought this might be noisy, the windows were effective sound proofing. The rooms are furnished with solid period furniture, and were cleaned efficiently and thoroughly. We did have trouble with the air conditioning, and couldn't seem to work it out, but to be fair to the hotel, we didn't ask for help, as the weather wasn't too hot this time of year. I would advise taking some insect repellent, (the room was provided with a plug-in mosquito device, but they are persistent ...) Excellent breakfast coffee, and the front desk staff were well informed if we had any queries. It could be that the hotel itself has taken note of earlier guests' comments and improved. Whatever the case, it seemed time to set the record straight, at least from our perspective, as we had a very pleasant stay and found everyone charming.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff Left Bad Impression”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaChickadee
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the rude staff this hotel would be a great value for the money. It's in a good location, rooms are nice, and breakfast is more than adequate. However, one of the desk clerks at this hotel was unspeakably rude to us and to others seeking his help. After several incidences of this during our stay, I made it clear to him that this behavior was not going to be tolerated and he was quite obsequious after that. At one point the maintenance person was sent to my room to repair an electrical outage and he was also unbelievably rude. What we found was that the more polite we were, the more obnoxious these people became - this improved only after we met their cold, unresponsive stares with the same. I also had an opportunity to witness the desk clerk doing his magic on some elderly guests who were standing there looking cowed and humiliated. I would never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely A/C room, very good breakfast and perfect position.”
Reviews.Author: Roald47
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple in the hotel for four nights during August 2010 booking through BA. The hotel is about a 25 minute walk from the bus/railway station if you are trying to save money, following the main route to San Marco (follow the signs) or is right next to a water bus stop. The hotel is positioned in a lovely square which looks out onto a church with venetian style engraving and is five minutes walk from San Marco square on the main route through the city. Perfect positioning in our eyes. We were greeted throughout our stay by very friendly receptionists who were always very helpful in answering the standard tourist questions. They all spoke very good English and were more than happy to help us check in online. The hotel was clean and had a very nice style, especially for the price paid. Our room was a standard double room which looked out onto the church in the square. It was perhaps what some people would consider small but it was plenty big enough especially if you are using it as a place to go and see the sights. Venice hotels generally have smaller rooms so that should be expected. The rooms were clean, our double was the standard continental two beds pushed together but we didnâ€™t really notice and it was comfortable. The rooms were very well air conditioned coping well with humid 30 degrees C outside, having to be turned down a lot of the time. The rooms were very quiet with the walls seemingly not letting any sound through even with a family with a baby next door and we didn't hear any noise from outside (the square was very quiet at night.) The bathroom was clean and had complementary shampoo etc. and was cleaned everyday with new towels given when required but not replaced every day. Food in Vencie is quite expensive so a big good breakfast was great. It was standard continental offering with a very wide selection (croissants with or without jam filing, fruit, ham, fruit salad etc.) all good quality food and they were more than happy for you to take as much as you wanted. Lots of hot drinks made to order which were nice. On nice days they had a small covered outside area open where you can sit and have breakfast or in the afternoon sit and watch the world go by which was really nice. One of the days we wanted tea in the afternoon. There was a waiter on duty that was more than willing to help and we were not charged which was even better. Another good point to note was the enthusiasm of all the staff including the cleaners who were always happy to help and polite when you met them. Overall I would recommend this hotel with it definitely living up to its three star rating.

Reviews.Title: “A really good place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Marlow010
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean with a comfortable bed and very effective air conditioning, a large bathroom with a real bath with shower over (made in England) and a large terrace. The staff were friendly, but not pushy. The best is the location - the back of the Hotel is next to one of the side canals used by singing Gondoliers - and their music floats up to entice you from your afternoon siesta (The outside temperature reached 36C when we were there and two hours in the cool of our room was more than welcome) We recommend this oasis to anyone, but they must bring their own kettle if, like us, you dare not ring for room service at 0600 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: judiegc
Reviews.Content: Very well situated near St Mark's Square and the Vaporetto stop, but the bedrooms are very small and the shower quite uncontrollable! Either scalding hot or freezing cold. One of the reception staff was positively rude but the others were OK. Breakfast average.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: kaz151
Reviews.Content: After reading some, not so nice reviews about this hotel, I book it anyway and crossed my fingers. To our relief it was in a fantastic location and easy to find (Stop No 13, Santa Maria del Giglio). Yes, it was old, but Venice is old. We found our room to be very clean and compacted, especially the bathroom, but it was part of the fun of being in Venice. It is one of the very few hotels that have a lift, so you donâ€™t have to worry about carrying your suitcases up any stairs, the very friendly porter even loaded us and our bags into the small lift and then he ran up the stairs to help us to our room. We woke up every morning to the delicious smell of croissants cooking, breakfast was included in the room rate and was a great start of the day. It has internet access but only in the down stairs lounge area or breakfast room, sadly it was a poor signal in the bedrooms. If we were ever lucky enough to go back to Venice, we would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: celticrose34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and had a very pleasant stay. If you're on somewhat of a budget but want to stay in a nice and comfortable hotel, this is the place. It's located next to San Marco place but in a more quiet campo in front of Santa Maria del Giglio, a beautiful church. It's also very simple to get there: you get off at the Giglio vaporetto stop, walk up the alley in front of you and it's there on your right in front of the chuch...very easy. The room was nicely decorated, cleaned every day and sheets changed every day. The breakfast had many choices of food and was very good. You can also have breakfast outside. The staff was very helpful and nice. We had a mini bar and a safe in the room. We even had a balcony facing the church...charming! The only negative thing I can say about it is the shower...a bit dangerous if you ask me! The floor of the shower was not even. It had like a step. It was hard to move in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnL17
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at Venice train station at 9.10 in the morning we took the water bus to where we hoped to be the closest stop. After a 5 minute walk through a narrow alley the hotel was right in front of us (great location). Our check in time was noon, but we arrived at abot 10.30, we asked could we leave our bags we were told our room was ready this was another bonus. The room was spotless and after an all night train journey from Paris very welcolme. During our stay the front desk were very helpfull with providing the correct adaptor for the laptop and the wifi range enabled me to sit on the terrece at the front of the hotel with good reception. The buffet breakfast was great. Overall I was very pleased with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great espresso (ok the room was nice, too)”
Reviews.Author: yun22
Reviews.Content: the website we booked the hotel at did not give us the complete address of the hotel. make sure to locate campo santa maria del giglio. that is the area the hotel is in. it is next to the san marco area (plaza). you take a ferry to venice from the airport that is on the mainland. do not take the water taxi. those are expensive. if you take the train out to let's say vienna, take the train out of santa lucia. do NOT take the ferry to the mainland and then the train to mestre. that is just not efficient. plus, mestre station is has shady people and it is very dirty. the hotel has free breakfast. it is a really good. lots of selections. the guy that gets you the espressos was really nice. we tipped him well on our last morning. the room was quite small, but i don't mind that too much, because the room was very clean. the bathroom was also very small, but it was all new and also very clean. think tokyo. all you need is in the room, but it is small. i personally loved it. the room was very cute how it was decorated. there is a flat screen tv in the room. the front desk was very helpful. there is no wifi in the room. you can ask the front desk about internet and they can either give you a key word to get on your own laptop (30 minutes, i think) or you can even borrow their laptop. good location. so close to san marco plaza. just a general tip to not carry a backpack during the day, because you will have to check it in everywhere. take a waterproof jacket in case it rains. i would stay at bel sito hotel again. i would recommend it to friends, too. hotels and hostels in venice are just expensive, so this one is a pretty good one in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: BradJanine
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a superb location. Excellent continental breakfasts, great caffe latte coffee. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The room size was generous by European standards. The bathroom had also recently been renovated wich was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_in_Calfornia
Reviews.Content: Imagine waking up to the smell of freshly baked crossiants every morning... listening to the birds chirping.. not a single car sound - pinch me, am I dreaming? Our room was right above the breakfast room downstairs so the morning smells were great, and the view too. Speaking of breakfast, we thought it was the best one of our whole trip. Our room was a great size, I was worried about reviews saying the rooms were small, but ours was perfect. The bathroom was a great size too- loved the old style decorating, in the bathroom, beautiful tile all the way up the walls. The service was great, they went out of their way to make sure our needs were met. The posted pictures show a canal entrance, I never saw that... I guess I didn't explore the hotel enough. The elevator was pretty small - and it did break down once, but management was right on it - while it was down, the tried to accomodate everyone. I heard they even moved an elderly couple to the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LizzyDublin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in Venice in the Bel Sito Hotel and was delighted with where it was situated. The room we were in was very small but had a lovely terrace outside which made up for it. It was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We got the LaLaguna boat to St. Mark's Square and walked to the hotel with the help of a map and it was not a problem, only about a ten minute walk. There's a restaurant just across the square where we had lunch one day and it was very good, everything was near by and we had a brilliant time, still haven't seen all we wanted to see though, ah well, we'll have to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel93
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and parents in Sept 2009. The hotel's location is very good - a few minutes walk to San Marco in one direction and to Accademia in the other direction. The breakfast buffet is very good - there are lots of options to choose from. We arrived after Venice was hammered by torrential rains and the hotel only flooded a little in the back - it did not interrupt our stay whatsoever. The one disappointment was that there was a party on a nearby (apartment) rooftop deck - and our hotel windows did not keep the sound out very well, so my husband and I were kept awake during 1 of our 3 night stay. All in all, the hotel is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Britainabroad
Reviews.Content: Good hotel convenient for 'bus' and all attractions near Grand Canal. Clean, good breakfast and very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “close to San Marco, relatively cheaper”
Reviews.Author: Chunxiao
Reviews.Content: good location, close to 'bus' station. moderate breakfast normally included. rooms are clean, with convenient facilities including air-conditioning. the serious receptionist with beard was not so friendly. rest was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LancashireLeyther
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for all the main attractions. The hotel is very clean and hotel staff were friendly. Room are small and quite dark but the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast is basic and on the last morning it was like fawlty towers as there was shortage of both food and utensils but this may have been a one off. The bar is just cans of beer and wine from storage. There was free use of a pc and the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kokv1432
Reviews.Content: Bel Sito was a great find in Venice. Located in a square right off the Giglio vaporetta stop, and less than 10 minutes from St. Marks Square, it's location was perfect for our first trip to Venice. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the breakfast was excellent, and offered outdoor seating. Although our bathroom was very tiny (it is, after all, in Italy) and the air conditioning wasn't working properly, the room was clean, compfortable, and opened onto the square facing the church . We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic & Bijous”
Reviews.Author: Winstan88
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet little square close to St Marks Square and only 10/15mins from everything else. However if you try and find it on an internet map it will say that it is near Rialto on the Grand Canal which is wrong, it is in the square behind the Giglo Vapperetto stop. Staff, I think that there are some cultural differences in the way that Europeans and English speakers communicate which are mis-conceived by English speakers as arrogance or disinterest. All staff were helpful and accommodated my appalling attempts to speak Italian and duly replied in English. Room was small with no where to store clothes but clean and tidy. The bathroom was small but again clean. We had a lovely view of the Church from our window. Breakfast was good boiled eggs, croissants, cereal and nice Cappuccinos. You are able to sit outside and eat your breakfast if you get up early enough which was great. Well deserved 3 star accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: VickyLynn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bel Sito was in a great location, close to St Marcs Square. Our room had a great view of the front of a church. Breakfast was great! Loved sitting outside on the patio for to eat our breakfast and watch people go by. Room and bathroom were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a good breakfast in Italy!”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I toured Italy this Spring. Venice was our final and favorite stop. After days of stale croissants and strong coffee at hotels throughout Italy, we were happily suprised by BEL SITO's buffet breakfast. My husband was flipping over the ham & eggs. The rooms were charming. We had a view of the canal. The staff went above and beyond even helping me recover my prescription eye glasses, that I had forgotten in the gondola. The night desk clerk is a little rude, but we were so full of wine and romance by then that we really didn't care. Just tell him "ciao" and head out the door. In five minutes, you'll be in San Marco square listening to the live quartets play classical music. BEL SITO was a located just far enough away from the herd like crowds that engulf San Marco, yet convenietly near everything. We joked that no matter where we asked to go, the staff would say 10 minutes. But it's really true. When we didn't get lost we made it to Rialto in 10 minutes. Salute church & the Guggenheim also took about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chesterimp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at end of July with wife & 2 teenage sons. Basic 3 star hotel, but clean and facilities adequate. Hotel is in 2 parts - main section (5,6 storeys?) over looking Campo and a fine Baroque Church; rear section across a courtyard with 4 first floor rooms nos A-D; (no lift to these, note). First 3 ovelook canal, lean out carefully for a view of a gondola stop & the Grand Canal. Avoid room D if you can - suspect a/c and dark outlook over courtyard, that one went to the 2 who didn't mind a hot room. Room C was fine. Both rooms had small but clean, daylit bathrooms with shower cubicles, which worked well and were preferable to baths with shower hoses which we came across elsewhere. We found front desk staff ok, during the whole holiday if you start off with trying to speak Italian it makes a big difference - a 'buon giourno' and a 'grazie' goes a long way (and you only need to try to say it, not spell it...). Some of the staff are more cheerful than others, some speak better English than others, that is to be expected. The porter/waiter/maintenance man was grouchy with me but I had fiddled with his a/c controller in room D, having missed being told not to. Breakfast was the most basic we came across but was what I would expect by the term 'Continental Breakfast', and was perfectly acceptable. The big plus is the location - 5 mins from St Marks, a 'vaporetto' stop at the end of the square. I disagree with the previous reviewer who suggested staying in the Lido was preferable. Here, you can see Venice waking up, get around the city easily, experience it at night. 3 stars for the hotel, one more for the location.

Reviews.Title: “A flaming nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: HolidaymakerBanchory
Reviews.Content: Our first night in Venice was in this hotel. On arrival we noted that the hotel was rather run down more so than Venetian character and room was rather basic. However as it was ideally located and we were only booked for two nights we decided to stay although I have to admit both of us were rather disappointed. At approximately 11-12pm that night I woke to a strong smell of smoke followed by banging at our door a few minutes later. This was our kindly downstairs resident alerting us to the fact that he had heard a popping noise in his bathroom and had discovered flames coming from his extractor fan which was not being used at the time. Concerned for our safety he alerted us and on opening our bathroom door thick smoke billowed out and molten plastic was falling from our extractor fan. The fire alarm was going off but was very quiet and throughout this whole episode the hotel was not fully evacuated. Thankfully we were near the main stairs which led to the only fire exit at the main door. To our alarm the door was locked when we got there! There was an italian porter in residence who spoke very little English and eventually opened this and phoned the fire brigade. We sat outside for over an hour and no information was imparted to us by hotel staff. Later after asking ourselves we were informed it had been an electrical fault and that we were safe to go back to our rooms. Yes, we were expected to go back to a smoke affected room as was our kindly neighbour downstairs. On pointing our that this would clearly not be safe our pleasant the staff offered us an alternative room at the other side of the hotel which was clearly the furthest from the only fire exit. After discussion we indicated that we would not feel comfortable sleeping there so at 2am checked out and walked round to book into an alternative hotel. I would certainly not advise anyone to stay at this hotel. Clearly there are issues with the electrics and little concept of fire safety or evacuation procedures. Whilst this is not a luxury hotel there can be no compromise on resident safety. Venice is wonderful I would hate for anyone else to have their first night in Venice tospoiled by the events related above.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Corsette
Reviews.Content: Great location & our room (A) had a fab view of the canal. Bathroom was small & when you have a shower water goes everywhere but overall was ok. Breakfast was standard. The reception was the worst experienced during our trip, the man was simply unwelcoming & cold. The night receptionist was sarcastic & rude but the lady who works during the day was nice, helpful & professional. (So was one of the waiters). The mini bar was poorly administered (not price list & looked like they threw a couple of bottles inside).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near San Marco”
Reviews.Author: kedavis4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Bel Sito & Berlino Hotel in Venice and absolutely loved the hotel. I made the reservation through Venere.com and by the next day had a confirmation from Venere.com AND from the hotel. It was extremely easy to find the hotel and get to -- just a short walk from the Vaporetto stop. Upon arrival, the staff were very efficient, courteous and helpful. I was traveling with my brother and sister-in-law so we required a room with three beds. I expected we would get a double bed and a cot and was greatly surprised to find a twin bed instead of a cot in a canal-side room that was quite spacious. Beds were actually quite comfortable as well. The bathroom was small but functional, the air-conditioner really worked (for which we were very grateful as it was in the 90s when we were there), and the hotel had an elevator. Breakfast was included -- standard juice, coffee, rolls but enough to keep us going first thing in the morning. The location was great. Only about a 5 minute walk from San Marco Square and yet very quiet at night. Room rate was 150 Euro/night which I thought was quite reasonable in Venice in high season. Highly recommend this hotel and will use it again on my next trip to Venice!

HotelInfo.Name: Bel Sito & Berlino
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco, 2517 | Campo Santa Maria del Giglio, 30124 Venice, Italy
